description:
T4 Listed as Pittosporum is a self-set Evergreen Oak that is unsuited to its restricted location
 T6 Cherry abuts the boundary wall and is unsuited to its restricted location
 T7 Yew is a young tree located adjacent to and under the crowns of adjacent trees: there is insufficient space for it to develop in this location.
 T9 Cotoneaster is a shrub
 T14a is a large shrub
 T18a Hawthorn is a leaning suppressed specimen of low public amenity
 T20 comprises two Leyland Cypress planted too close together
 T1 Laburnum - Remove Ivy
 T2 Laburnum - Remove Ivy
 T3 Laburnum - Remove Ivy
 T4 Pittosporum (Evergreen Oak) - Fell to ground level and poison stump
 T5 Silver Birch - Reduce crown by 2m in height and balance
 T6 Cherry - Fell to ground level and poison stump
 T7 Yew - Fell to ground level and poison stump
 T8 Ash - Reduce crown by 4m in height and balance remainder
 T9 Cotoneaster - Fell to ground level and poison stump
 T12 Silver Birch - Reduce crown by 2m in height and balance remainder
 G13 Ash x 4 - Lift to 5m above ground level. Prune to clear light
 T14a Elder - Fell to ground level and poison stump
 T16 Ash - Reduce crown by 3m in height and balance remainder. Lift crown to 4m above ground level
 T17 Cherry - Reduce crown by 3m in height and balance remainder. Lift crown to 4m above ground level
 T18a Hawthorn - Fell to ground level and poison stump
 T19 - London Plane - Remove deadwood. Lift crown to 6m all round
 T20 - Leyland Cypress Remove larger tree of two. Raise/lift remaining tree over footpath
 T21 - Horse Chestnut Thin crown by 20%. Remove deadwood and lift canopy to 6m above ground level all round. Prune to clear light.
 T26 - Sycamore Reduce crown by 3m in height and 2-3m in lateral spread all round, remove Ivy
